name: In-Fisherman Bass Hunter 64
description: In-Fisherman Bass Hunter 64 (known as Bass Hunter 64 outside North America) is a single-player fishing video game for the Nintendo 64 developed by GearHead Entertainment and published by Take-Two Interactive. It was the first Nintendo 64 fishing game outside Japan, following the region-exclusive Nushi Tsuri 64. It was released in North America on June 30, 1999 and in Europe on October 22, 1999. A Game Boy adaptation of the game, simply titled In-Fisherman Bass Hunter, was announced to be in development at Tarantula Studios in June 1998, but ultimately stayed unreleased.
